en.purpose: To classify breast cancer using the TNM system by recording all required tumour characteristics, nodal involvement, and distant metastasis, and to determine the corresponding AJCC/UICC stage group.
en.use:
Use to record the tumour, lymph node, and metastasis status necessary to assign a TNM category and stage group for breast cancer.
The guideline uses structured inputs for invasive tumour size, in-situ type, chest wall and skin involvement, inflammatory carcinoma status, regional lymph node involvement patterns, and presence of distant metastasis.
The calculated TNM categories (T, N, M) and the final stage group (0–IV) follow the definitions provided in the AJCC/UICC TNM Classification of Malignant Tumours.
en.misuse: Not to be used for recording TNM classification for cancers outside the breast.
